Replace.Text: +1 [ICON_Food] Food to [ICON_Resource_Bananas] Bananas and [ICON_Resource_Deer] Deer resources in this city.
Increases growth of this city by 50%.
Hospital
Increases growth of this city by 50%.
Medical Lab

Increases growth of this city by 50%. Additional +50% when [ICON_Power] Powered. Its base [ICON_Food] Food bonus is extended to all City Centers within 6 tiles that do not already have a bonus from this building type.
+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for each specialty district in this city. +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for each Wonder in this city.

+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for each specialty district in this city. +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for each Wonder in this city. Holds [ICON_GreatWork_Landscape] Great Works of Art. May not be built in a Theater Square district that already has an Archaeological Museum.

+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for each specialty district in this city. +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for each Wonder in this city. Holds [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifacts. May not be built in a Theater Square district that already has an Art Museum.
Opera House
+33% [ICON_Culture] Culture in this city.

+33% [ICON_Culture] Culture in this city, Additional +34% when [ICON_Power] Powered. Its bonus[ICON_Culture] Culture when [ICON_Power] Powered is extended to all City Centers within 6 tiles that do not already have a bonus from this building type.
+0.5 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science per [ICON_Citizen] Citizen in this city.
+33% [ICON_SCIENCE] Science in this city.
Public School
+0.5 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science per [ICON_Citizen] Citizen in this city.

+33% [ICON_SCIENCE] Science in this city, +34% additionally when [ICON_Power] Powered. Its bonus [ICON_SCIENCE] Science when [ICON_Power] Powered is extended to all City Centers within 6 tiles that do not already have a bonus from this building type.

+25% combat experience for all cavalry and siege class units trained in this city. Pastures in this city gain +1 [ICON_Production] Production.[NEWLINE]Strategic Resource Stockpiles increased +10 (on Standard Speed).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May not be built in an Encampment district that already has a Barracks.
{LOC_BUILDING_BANK_DESCRIPTION_SST}{LOC_BUILDING_MARKET_EXPANSION1_DESCRIPTION}
+25% [ICON_Gold] Gold in this city.

+25% [ICON_Gold] Gold in this city, +25% additionally when [ICON_Power] Powered. Its bonus [ICON_Gold] Gold when [ICON_Power] Powered is extended to all City Centers within 6 tiles that do not already have a bonus from this building type.
+10% [ICON_Production] Production in this city.
+15% [ICON_Production] Production in this city.
{LOC_PRODUCTION_10_SST} +1 [ICON_Production] Production to [ICON_Resource_Stone] Stone and [ICON_Resource_Copper] Copper resources in this city.
+10% [ICON_Production] Production in this city. Its base [ICON_Production] Production bonus is extended to all City Centers within 6 tiles that do not already have a bonus from this building type.
{LOC_PRODUCTION_15_SST}{LOC_BUILDING_POWER_PLANT_EXPANSION2_DESCRIPTION}
{LOC_PRODUCTION_15_SST}{LOC_BUILDING_COAL_POWER_PLANT_DESCRIPTION}
{LOC_PRODUCTION_15_SST}{LOC_BUILDING_FOSSIL_FUEL_POWER_PLANT_DESCRIPTION}
Manufacturing Plant

{LOC_PRODUCTION_15_SST} Get +50% [ICON_Production] Production towards city projects in this city. Its bonus [ICON_Production] Production when [ICON_Power] Powered is extended to all City Centers within 6 tiles that do not already have a bonus from this building type.

+25% combat experience for all naval units trained in this city. +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food on all Coast tiles for this city. [ICON_RESOURCE_FISH] Fish, [ICON_RESOURCE_CRABS] Crabs, [ICON_RESOURCE_PEARLS] Pearls and [ICON_RESOURCE_TURTLES] Turtles in this city gain +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food. +2 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing if this city is adjacent to coast. +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity, if this city does not yet have a Market building.

+25% combat experience for all naval units trained in this city. Bonus [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production equal to the adjacency bonus of the Harbor district. +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production on all Coast and Lake tiles for this city.

+25% combat experience for all naval units trained in this city. Allows Fleets and Armadas to be trained directly. Fleet and Armada training costs reduced 25%. +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production on all Coast tiles for this city.

Bonus [ICON_Amenities] Amenities extend to each city center within 9 tiles. This bonus applies once to a city, and multiple copies of this building within 9 tiles of a city center do not provide additional bonuses. +5 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism for each Wonder built in this city on or adjacent to a Coast tile.

Bonus [ICON_Amenities] Amenities extend to each city center within 6 tiles. This bonus applies once to a city, and multiple copies of this building within 6 tiles of a city center do not provide additional bonuses. +10 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism if the city population is 10 or higher and +10 additional [ICON_Tourism] Tourism if the city population is 20 or higher.
{LOC_PRODUCTION_15_SST} City Centers within 6 tiles receive +6 [ICON_Power] Power from renewable water sources.
+50% [ICON_Tourism] to this city's Great Works, Wonders, Improvements, and National Parks. +25% combat experience for air units trained in this city. +1 air unit slot in Aerodrome district.

+5% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism across your empire. +50% combat experience for air units trained in this city. +1 air unit slot in Aerodrome district. Allows the ability to airlift land units between Aerodrome districts with Airports after the Rapid Deployment civic is unlocked.
+4 [ICON_Food] Food for each Neighborhood in this city. Can only be built once in a city, even if the city has multiple Neighborhoods.

+4 [ICON_Gold] Food for each Neighborhood in this city. Additional +4 [ICON_Gold] when [ICON_Power] Powered. +10 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism if the city's [ICON_Citizen] Population is 10 or higher; +20 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism if the city's [ICON_Citizen] Population is 20 or higher; Can only be built once in a city, even if the city has multiple Neighborhoods.

A building unique to Japan. {LOC_PRODUCTION_10_SST} Provides +4 [ICON_Culture] Culture to this city after researching the Electricity technology. Its [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production bonus is extended to all City Centers within 6 tiles that do not already have a bonus from this building type.
A building unique to America. +100% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism pressure from this city towards other civilizations when the game enters the Modern era. {LOC_BUILDING_BROADCAST_CENTER_DESCRIPTION_SST}

A building unique to the Ottomans. {LOC_BUILDING_BANK_DESCRIPTION_SST} Accumulate 1 extra Strategic resource for every different type of Strategic resource this city has improved. Receive 1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity for every Luxury resource this city has improved.
A building unique to Arabia. {LOC_BUILDING_UNIVERSITY_DESCRIPTION_SST} Bonus [ICON_FAITH] Faith equal to the adjacency bonus of the Campus district.

A building unique to the Māori. {LOC_BUILDING_AMPHITHEATER_DESCRIPTION_SST} +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_FAITH] Faith to all of this city's tiles with a passable feature or natural wonder. After Flight is researched receive +1 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism to all of this city's tiles with a feature or natural wonder. Costs no maintenance. Has no Great Work slots.

A building unique to Portugal. {LOC_BUILDING_UNIVERSITY_DESCRIPTION_SST} +25% Production towards naval units in this city. +1 [ICON_SCiENCE] Science for every two coast or lake tiles in this city. +1 [ICON_GreatAdmiral] Great Admiral and +1 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist point per turn.

A building unique to Poland. {LOC_BUILDING_BANK_DESCRIPTION_SST} International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes from this city gain +2 [ICON_Production] Production; domestic [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes gain +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold. +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity, if this city does not yet have a Lighthouse building.

A building unique to Hungary. +3 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities and +2 Production extends to each city center within 6 tiles. These bonuses apply once to a city, and multiple copies of this building within 6 tiles of a city center do not provide additional bonuses. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This city receives +3 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism and +2 additional [ICON_Amenities] Amenities if there is at least one Geothermal Fissure in this city's borders.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Trading Dome.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every adjacent Luxury resource. Your outgoing international [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes grant +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold per Trading Dome at the origin. Cannot be built next to another Trading Dome.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Ziggurat, unique to Sumeria.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+3 [ICON_Science] Science. +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture if next to River. Researching Civil Engineering grants additional [ICON_Culture] Culture. Cannot be built on Hills but may be built on Floodplains. Cannot be built adjacent to another Ziggurat.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Cahokia Mounds.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Cities receive +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity from their first Cahokia Mound improvement. Upon discovering Colonialism, cities receive +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity from their second Cahokia Mound improvement. +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for every 2 adjacent Districts once Feudalism is discovered or for every adjacent District once Replaceable Parts is researched. Provides +1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing. Receive an additional [ICON_HOUSING] Housing once Cultural Heritage is discovered. Cannot be built adjacent to other Cahokia Mounds.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Sphinx, unique to Egypt.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture. +2 Appeal. +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith if next to a wonder. +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture if built on Floodplains. Additional [ICON_CULTURE] Culture once Colonialism is discovered. Provides [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after researching Flight. Cannot be built next to another Sphinx. Cannot be built on Snow or Snow Hills.

One tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Volcano and provides +3 [ICON_Food] Food to adjacent tiles. On eruption it gives low yields and is most likely to damage improvements and buildings. Infrequently erupts, but is always active.
Four tile natural wonder. Provides +3 [ICON_Food] Food, +1 [ICON_Production] Production, and +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Three tile impassable natural wonder. Naval combat units that enter adjacent plots are granted their next promotion. Adjacent plots yield +1 [ICON_Production] Production.
Two tile impassable natural wonder. Land combat units that enter adjacent plots receive the ability 'Spear of Fionn' (+5 combat strength). Adjacent plots yield +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Four tile natural wonder. It provides +2 [ICON_Food] Food, +3 [ICON_Production] Production, and +1 [ICON_Science] Science.
One tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +5 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +3 [ICON_Science] Science, and Fresh Water.

Two tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +4 [ICON_Culture] Culture. Units heal completely if they heal for one turn adjacent to the Dead Sea. Does not provide Fresh Water.
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_Production] Production and +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to adjacent tiles.

Three tile natural wonder. Provides +4 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science. After the game reaches the Atomic Era it provides an additional +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science.
Three tile natural wonder. It provides +4 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +2 [ICON_Production] Production.
Two tile natural wonder that can be found on coastal terrain and provides +4 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_Science] Science. Major adjacency bonus to the Campus district.

Two tile natural wonder that can be found on coastal terrain and provides +3 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. +15 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending in this tile.
Two tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +3 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. Does not provide Fresh Water.
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith and +1 [ICON_Production] Production to adjacent tiles.

One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture to adjacent tiles. Land combat units who move next to the Matterhorn ignore Hills for the rest of the game and gain +3[ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in hills.

One tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Volcano and provides +2 [ICON_Production] Production to adjacent tiles. On Eruption it gives high yields to adjacent tiles, but large [ICON_Citizen] Population loss. It is always active.

Three-tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to adjacent tiles. The city that owns the tile receives +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold on its outgoing international [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes.

Two tile impassable natural wonder. +2 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenities. It provides an additional [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity if adjacent to an Entertainment Complex. Major adjacency bonus to Theater Square, Campus, and Commercial Hub districts. Standard adjacency bonus to the Holy Site district. It provides Fresh Water.
Four tile natural wonder. It provides +2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science, +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, and +4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Science] Science to adjacent tiles.
Four tile natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith, +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, and +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.

Three tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture to adjacent tiles. Provides 2 [ICON_GREATGENERAL] Great General points and 2 [ICON_GREATMERCHANT] Great Merchant points if you own at least one of these tiles.
Receive the [ICON_RESOURCE_CINNAMON] Cinnamon and [ICON_RESOURCE_CLOVES] Cloves Luxury resources. These cannot be earned any other way in the game, and provide 3 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities each.

A district in your city specializing in finance and trade. Domestic [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes from this city provide +1 [ICON_Production] Production and +1 [ICON_Food] Food, and International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes provide +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold.

A district for naval activity in your city. Domestic [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes from this city provide +1 [ICON_Production] Production and +1 [ICON_Food] Food, and International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes provide +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold if this city does not yet have a Commercial Hub district. Also removes the [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty for embarking and disembarking to and from this tile. Must be built on Coast or Lake Terrain adjacent to land. Cannot be built on Reef.
